1.2.1.title: Ensure all public repositories contain a SECURITY.md file
1.2.1.description: SECURITY.md file is a security policy file, which gives people instructions when they are reporting security vulnerabilities in a project. When someone creates an issue in that project, a link to the SECURITY.md file will be shown.
1.2.1.remediation: For each repository in use, create a SECURITY.md file and save it in the documents or root directory of the repository.

1.2.2.title: Ensure repository creation is limited to specific members
1.2.2.description: Limit the ability to create repositories to trusted users and teams.
1.2.2.remediation: Restrict repository creation to trusted users and teams only.

1.2.3.title: Ensure repository deletion is limited to specific members
1.2.3.description: Ensure only a limited number of trusted members can delete repositories.
1.2.3.remediation: Enforce repository deletion by a few trusted and responsible users only.

1.2.4.title: Ensure issue deletion is limited to specific members
1.2.4.description: Ensure only trusted an responsible members can delete issues.
1.2.4.remediation: Restrict issue deletion to a few trusted and responsible users only.
